intro: Plagius flosculosus, commonly known as the small-flowered plagius, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its small, white or pale blue flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
